info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 21 at 9:24PM CDT until June 22 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR EASTERN DICKENS...SOUTHWESTERN KING AND SOUTHWESTERN COTTLE COUNTIES... At 923 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located 13 miles north of Girard, or 14 miles east of Dickens, moving south at 35 mph. A second confirmed tornado was located about 5 miles east southeast of Dickens in rural Dickens county. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Dumont and Afton. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
